text: When we use the date picker we will get internal values like 445959533000. Obviously this value will represent a date, but since we use this property value inside a Whatsapp message (Messagebird) we would like to convert it to a string (23-04-22 for example). How can we convert this value to a date?

HI team, i have integrated HubSpot Webhooks for property changes,
When i do any changes for the multiple properties at a time like (city, state, zip) am receiving multiple webhook hits are receiving
because of this, from my application end unable to get which data i need to follow
can any one suggest why webhooks are sending multiple times for different property changes

Hi All. I have an email permissions question. I have a client that wants to send and email to a list of contacts from their CRM (not HubSpot). These contacts are net new to HubSpot and there’s no verifiable consent.

I told the client these contacts cannot be sent marketing emails without it. Their follow up question asked if there was a way to obtain consent. From my understanding  there isn’t. I thought about a permission pass campaign where we could send an email requesting permission. Those who responded we could contact. But I don’t think this is within permissions compliance either.

Typically, a permission email is verifying whether they’ve opted in or not. Any thoughts on this?
